DOC.brief_summary: The study is designed to test if there is any correlation between the glucose levels in the postoperatory period and the length of hospital stay.
DOC.brief_title: Correlation of Hospital Stay Length With the Glucose Levels After Cardiac Surgery
DOC.detailed_description: The stress hyperglycemia commonly observed in the postoperatory period, there have been several studies to assess if there is benefit of having a strict glucose control or not. This study will assess if there is correlation between the glucose levels measured continuously with the length of the stay in the hospital.
DOC.criteria: Physical status classification of the American Society of Anesthesiologists (ASA) IIIV Patients programmed for cardiac surgery Any body mass index Pregnant women Chronic Kidney Disease (CKD) Stage 2 or higher
